11:08 <KermitTheFragger> hi all, im working on a SAML implementation for XWiki and I was wondering; Is there an "nice" easy way to get an XWiki user by email addres? (before a start writing raw queries).  
11:20 <tmortagne> KermitTheFragger: no, you will have to use queries  
11:20 <tmortagne> by the way did you looked at https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/authenticator-saml ?  
11:26 <KermitTheFragger> tmortagne: yes I did. I was planning to implement single logout  
11:26 <KermitTheFragger> but OpenSAML is a behemoth...I did an implementation with it once. Its huge and its easy to make mistakes  
11:27 <KermitTheFragger> OpenSAML is a really low level SAML implementation which exposes you to all the gory details of SAML  
11:27 <KermitTheFragger> So i decided to do an implementation based upon OneLogin's SAML library: https://github.com/onelogin/java-saml  
11:28 <KermitTheFragger> you can literally do with 4 lines for which you need like 60+ lines of low level SAML stuff in OpenSAML  
11:28 <KermitTheFragger> configuration is also really easy via the onelogin.saml.properties file  
11:29 <tmortagne> ok, sounds good  
11:29 <tmortagne> might be a 2.0 for https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/authenticator-saml ;)  
11:29 <KermitTheFragger> yeah i will release the source once It's done and cleaned it up a bit ;-)  
11:30 <tmortagne> actually https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/authenticator-saml probably never been formely released  
11:30 <tmortagne> just built when needed from what I remember  
11:30 <tmortagne> so that could be a 1.0 :)  
11:31 <KermitTheFragger> yeah it looks okay but its certainly build to fit a very specific need of someone :-)  
11:31 <KermitTheFragger> I thought about using OpenID but the single logout of OpenID with the hidden IFrame and stuf....I dunno....;-)  
11:32 <KermitTheFragger> SAML allows the IDP to directly call the SP for a logout  
11:32 <KermitTheFragger> and i'm shielded from the XML hell by OneLogin's library :-)
